TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class AppDomainIsolatedTask : MarshalByRefObject, Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit AppDomainIsolatedTask extends System.MarshalByRefObject implements class Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask

Docs.summary: Provides the same functionality as , but also derives from so that it can be instantiated in its own app domain.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Resources.ResourceManager taskResources) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and allows derived classes to register their resources.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Resources.ResourceManager taskResources, string helpKeywordPrefix) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and allows derived classes to register their resources, as well as provide a prefix for composing help keywords from string resource names.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the prefix is an empty string, then string resource names will be used verbatim as Help keywords. For an example of how the prefix is used, see the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper.LogErrorWithCodeFromResources%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the build engine interface that is available to tasks.
Docs.value: The that is available to tasks.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The build engine automatically sets this property to allow tasks to call back into it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Execute() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method must be implemented by the derived class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the prefix that is used to compose Help keywords from string resource names.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that is used to compose Help keywords. This value can be .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If a task does not have help keywords associated with its messages, it can ignore this property or set it to null. If the prefix is set to an empty string, then string resource names will be used verbatim as help keywords. For an example of how this prefix is used, see the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper.LogErrorWithCodeFromResources%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a host object instance that is associated with the derived .
Docs.value: The host object instance that is associated with the derived . This value can be .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The build engine sets this property if the host IDE has associated a host object with this particular task.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object InitializeLifetimeService() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gives tasks infinite lease time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Otherwise, a limited lease of 5 minutes will result; and task instances can expire if they take a long time to process.

Docs.summary: Gets an instance of a task logging helper object that contains task logging methods.
Docs.value: A that contains task logging methods.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets culture-specific resources of the derived .
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Resources.ResourceManager> that is a culture-specific resource of the derived . This value can be .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Derived classes should register their resources either during construction, or through this property, if they have localized strings.
